I was due to fly to Faro on Saturday 21st March 2020 with Easyjet. We were contacted by the company who we had booked excursions with to say that the Algarve and Porto were the hot spots and some restaurants, bars etc had already taken the decision to close/reduce numbers. As it was likely monuments, museums etc would follow suit along with the closure of schools and universities in the coming days, our trips were cancelled and refunded. We took the decision to postpone the whole trip as we have no idea if the flight would leave on Saturday, there would be something to do when we got there, and we whether we could get home again. As things change on a daily basis, you are pretty much going to have to make up your own mind. Easyjet are currently allowing you to change bookings free of charge, just paying the difference in the cost of the flight. We couldn't really cancel as we booked everything separately, but hopefully might get away later in the year.
